content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Monica and Chandler are sitting on one of the chairs doing a crossword puzzle.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you guys doing up?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, we wanted to finish the crossword before we went to bed. Hey, do you know a six-letter word for red?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dark red.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I think that’s wrong, but there’s a Connect the Dots in here for you later. (To Monica) Hey, how about maroon?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, you are so smart! (Kisses him.)
content.parenthetical: checks to see if it works

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aww, you guys are so cute!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I’ll see you in the morning.

content.speaker: Chandler and Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.description: Joey’s bedroom, time lapse. He’s asleep and dreaming. In his dream he’s doing the crossword puzzle with…wait for it…Monica!

content.speaker: Dream Monica
content.text: Y’know, I love doing crossword puzzles with you honey!

content.speaker: Dream Joey
content.text: Aww, me too. Now let’s finish this and go to bed.

content.speaker: Dream Monica
content.text: Okay! There’s only one left, three letter word, not dog but…

content.speaker: Dream Joey
content.text: Cat.

content.speaker: Dream Monica
content.text: Yes! You are so smart! (Kisses him.) I love you.

content.speaker: Dream Joey
content.text: I love you too.
(They hug.)
[Cut back to Joey in bed, he’s smiling, enjoying the dream as he wakes up. Suddenly, he realized what he was dreaming about and bolts upright in bed.]

content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there but Ross and Joey. Gunther hands them the bill, and Chandler gives some money to pay it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uhh, we still need a tip.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. Hold on. (She starts digging in the chair.) I got it. Nickel! (Donates it.) How much more do we need?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A couple of bucks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, dime! (Donates that.) You guys should probably keep talking; this could take a while. (Finds something else.) Oh no, wait! Look it! Whoa! (Looks at it.) Oh my God, this is a police badge!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s so cool! Why would a cop come in here though? They don’t serve donuts. (No one laughs.) Y’know what actually, could you discover the badge again? I think I can come up with something better than that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, I bet somebody’s missing that badge.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I should probably take it back. Ooh, but you know what? While I’m at the police station, I could check their Ten Most Wanted lists because my friend Fritzy has been like number 11 forever, so this could be her year! (She crosses her fingers in hope.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you guys!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Joey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. That uh, that my sweatshirt?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yes, it is. I’m sorry I borrowed it, I was cold. I hope its okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well uh, it’s just that uh, y’know if-if you’re gonna be wearing someone’s sweatshirt shouldn’t it be your boyfriends—and I’m not him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry, I’ll give it back to you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no! No! I mean it’s gonna be all smelling like Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you saying I smell bad?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No, you smell like a meadow. (Pause.) I’m sorry. (Runs to the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s with him?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, y’know what? The last time Joey went to a meadow, his mother was shot by a hunter.

content.description: A couch store, Ross is trying to decide on a new couch for his place. He has dragged Rachel along for the trip, and she’s not too happy about it. Ross is sitting on it in different ways to see how it feels. He tries to just sit on it normally, and then he tries flopping on it. One thing about this couch, it’s huge. It’s like twice the size of a normal full size couch. Whoever designed this thing, needs help and fast.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I still don’t know. (To the salesman who is hovering nearby) I’m sorry I just wanna make sure that I bought the right couch. I need a couch that says, “Kids welcome here.” But that also says, (In a sexy voice) “Come here to me!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! You say that to kids?!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! No! The “Come here to me” is y’know for the ladies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, honey, it’s a nice couch. It’s not a magic couch.

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: You picked a great couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Yeah. Could you just sign right here please? (Hands him a clipboard.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, sure. Whoa-whoa, what’s this? The delivery charge is almost as much as the couch!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait! No, that’s ridiculous. Come on, he lives three blocks away!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, y’know what? I’ll take it myself, thank you! (He signs the form and hands it back to the salesman.) All right Rach, let’s go! (He picks up one end of the couch.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! (She puts on her coat and turns around and sees Ross is expecting her to help.) (Laughing.) Are you kiddin’?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, come on it’s only three blocks! And-and, it’s not very heavy, try it! Come on! Come on!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Oh! I can do it!
content.parenthetical: Disgustedly she goes and tries to pick up the couch. Much to her amazement, she is successful.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: You two are really gonna enjoy that couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, we’re uh, yeah we’re not together. (He starts backing out of the store.)

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Ohh, okay. (Laughs.) Something didn’t quite add up there. (Ross stops, walks back to talk to the salesman, and in the process pushes Rachel up against a wall.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s that supposed to mean?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Well you, her, I mean, she’s very…y’know. And you’re like…y’know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not that it’s any of your business, but we did go out.

content.speaker: The Salesman
content.text: Really? You two?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on, I don’t really want to be doing this right now. I am carrying a very heavy couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then tell him quickly.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine! (To the salesman) We went out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not only did we go out, we did it 298 times!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross!! Oh my—ugh!! You kept count?! You are such a loser!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A loser you did it with (To the salesman) 298 times!
(Rachel pushes on the couch and pushes Ross out the door.)

content.description: Outside of Central Perk, Phoebe is exiting and sees a woman put out her cigarette on a tree.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Oh! Ma’am? Excuse me, ma’am?

content.speaker: The Smoking Woman
content.text: Yes?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You can’t put your cigarette out on a tree!

content.speaker: The Smoking Woman
content.text: Yeah I can, it worked real well.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No but you shouldn’t! Don’t ever do that again.

content.speaker: The Smoking Woman
content.text: I won’t! (Turns away) Until I have my next cigarette.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hold it! (Grabs the badge) N.Y.P.D! Freeze punk!

content.speaker: The Smoking Woman
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah that’s right you are so busted. (To no one in particular.) Book ’em.

content.speaker: The Smoking Woman
content.text: Who are you talking too?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Save it Red! Unless you wanna spend the night in the slammer, you apologize to the tree.

content.speaker: The Smoking Woman
content.text: I am not going to apologize to a tree!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You apologize to the tree right now or I am calling for backup. (The woman calls her bluff.) (Screaming at no one in particular) Backup! Backup!!

content.speaker: The Smoking Woman
content.text: I-I’m sorry! Sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, cancel backup! Cancel backup!

content.description: Ross’s building’s lobby, he and Rachel are about to attempt to take the couch upstairs.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. (Throws off the last cushion.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, didn’t you say that there was an elevator in here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhh, yes I did but there isn’t. Okay, here we go.

(They start the attempt. Ross is going backwards and reaches the first landing. This staircase has three steps then a landing, makes a 90-degree turn, and has more steps before another landing and another 90-degree turn.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, go left. Left! Left! (The bottom of the couch is hitting the railing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, y’know what? There is no more left, left!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh okay, lift it straight up over your head! Straight up over your head! You can do it! You can do it! (She gets it lifted up and they make the first turn.) Okay. You got it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good-good-good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-oh!
(She can’t stay at the end as the couch rounds the turn so she shifts to the back corner of the couch and is at a 90-degree angle to it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, you got it right? You got it right? You got it?
(She don’t got it as the couch slips out of their grips and falls over the bottom railing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Any chance you think the couch looks good there?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Phoebe is telling Chandler and Monica how she fought crime in her own way with the badge she found.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: …so this guy was all (Mumbles.) And I’m all, Buffay, Homicide. (Flashes the badge.) It was just so cool!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, you were supposed to take that back!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know but I’m having so much fun doing good deeds.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but impersonating a police officer is a serious thing. You could get arrested.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You could get arrested, right now! (Flashes the badge and they glare at her.) All right, yeah, I gotta take it back. I’m totally drunk with power. (She heads for the door just as Joey enters.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (Sees that Monica’s there.) Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi, Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I didn’t know you guys were going to be here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Joey, sweetie, taste this. (Holds out a spoon for him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! Why?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is going on with you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, come on! You’ve been acting strange all day!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! There is something. I kinda had a dream, (pause) but I don’t want to talk about it. (Starts for his room.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa-what-what if Martin Luther King had said that? (Imitating what his famous speech would sound like.) I kinda have a dream! I don’t want to talk about it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, it involved Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You had a dream about a girl that I am seeing?! Oh, that is so cool! (To Monica) I can’t tell you how many times I’ve dreamt about a girl that he was seeing. (Seeing Monica’s stare.) (To Joey) Anyway we’re talking about your dream. (To Monica) I love you. (To Joey) Your dream? (Leans in to listen closely.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t worry, there wasn’t any sex in it or anything. I haven’t dreamt about her like that since I found out about you two—ish.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What was the dream about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, okay. You were my girlfriend and we were doing the crossword puzzle. Y’know like you guys were doing last night. So, that’s it. I’m in love with Monica and I’ll be moving out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait, Joey! Joey! That doesn’t mean that-that you’re in love with me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It-it doesn’t?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it can mean anything. Like uh, all of the sudden you’re jealous because I’ve become the apartment stud.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That kinda sounds like your dream dude.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Or, it could mean that-that you saw Chandler and me together and we y’know were being close and stuff and then you just want to have that with someone too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: In the dream I did enjoy the closeness.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, look, are you attracted to Monica? Right here, right now, are you attracted to her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not really.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well there you have it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well sure! I’m just wearing sweats! (Looking at Chandler and slowly realizing what his point is.) But that’s good that you’re not in love with me, because you just want a girlfriend!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I don’t think it’s just about just getting a girlfriend. Y’know? I mean, yeah, I can get a girlfriend! Yeah, we could sit in the chair and do crosswords, but y’know are we ever going to have y’know the closeness like-like you guys have?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well y’know, Monica and I were friends before we started dating. So maybe-maybe that’s it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Friends first? That’s interesting.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You become friends after?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, never done that either.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, umm, do you guys have that tape measure?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, it’s actually in my bedroom.
(Monica and Chandler both remember a special moment between them.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right.
(They realize the implication of their behavior, stop instantly and head for his bedroom. In the meanwhile, Joey is starring at Rachel in a seductive way.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s up Joey?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How you doin’?
(Rachel is stunned.)

content.description: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is walking up and notices a car that is parked half on the curb and right in front of the door, making it difficult for people to enter Central Perk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Excuse me, is this your car?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well I don’t think it’s very nice of you to park here, y’know you’re blocking the entrance.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Don’t worry about it. It’s not a problem.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it’s a problem for me, which means it’s a problem for you ’cause I’m a cop. (Shows the badge.)

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: So am I!
content.parenthetical: he reaches into the car and slams his siren on the roof.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, no. (Pause) Oh okay, so you’re a cop which means you can park anywhere, ’cause I know that ’cause I’m a cop too. So, all right, keep up the good work. 10-4. (Tries to leave.)

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Hey, wait a second! So wait, what precinct are you with?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I’m with the umm, the 57 th .

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Oh, I know a guy in homicide up there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m in vice. Yeah, in fact I’m undercover right now. I’m a whore.

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Who-who else is in vice up there?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, do you know, umm Sipowicz?

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Sipowicz? No, I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, big guy, kinda bald.

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: No, I don’t know him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t try to call him or anything, ’cause he’s not there, he’s out. His umm, his partner just died.
content.parenthetical: starts to walk away, but stops

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Wow umm, tell Sipowicz I’m real sorry for his loss.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I-I sure will, take care. (Starts walking off.)

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Hey by the way, I’m sure Sipowicz is gonna be all right. I heard that kid from Silver Spoons is really good. (Phoebe’s stunned) And where did you find my badge?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. (She starts laughing. Then she throws the badge at him and runs away.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is entering. Rachel is there getting some tools to help Ross out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Joey, would you mind giving me and Ross a hand moving his couch?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I’d love too, but I got acting class. But y’know what? I guess I can blow that off, (In a sexy voice) for you.
(He starts staring at her longingly.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, hey, Rach let me ask you something. Uh, I was just over there talking to Monica and Chandler, boy they are really tight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah that’s not such a bad situation they got going over there. I’m thinking of getting me one of those.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s up Joe?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, the reason I think Monica and Chandler are so great…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …is because they were friends first. Y’know? So I asked myself, ”Who are my friends?” You and Phoebe, and I saw you first. So…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you saying?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m saying maybe you and I crank it up a notch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know honey, umm, as uh, as flattered as I am that uh, you saw me first, uhh, I just, I-I don’t think we should be cranking anything up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll treat you real nice. (Pulls out a chair for her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well, y’know umm… No honey, listen I think it’s a great idea to become friends with someone before you date them, but I think the way you do it is y’know you meet someone, become their friend, build a foundation, then you ask them out on a date. Don’t hit on your existing friends!
content.parenthetical: laughs and pushes the chair back in

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Won’t-won’t that take longer?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Yeah. Oh, but once you find it, ohh it’s so worth the wait.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. I understand. I understand. (Pause) Man , I wish I saw Phoebe first!

content.description: The lobby of Ross’s building, he’s sitting on the couch at the bottom of the stairs, and he’s practicing enticing women to join him on the couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come here to me. No-no, you come here to me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Ross! I brought reinforcements.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh great! What, you brought Joey?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I brought the next best thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler?! You brought Chandler?! The next best thing would be Monica!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I would be offended, but Monica is freakishly strong, so…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I-I drew a sketch about how we’re gonna do it. (Showing them) Okay Rach, (points to the sketch) that’s you. That’s the couch. (Points again.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa-oh, what’s-what’s that? (Points.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, that’s me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! You certainly think a lot of yourself.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! That’s-that’s my arm!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I see. I thought you just really, really liked your new couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? Just-just follow my lead.
(Chandler and Ross head for opposite ends of the couch.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, Chandler.
(They pick up the couch and after throwing off the last pillow; Rachel helps out on Chandler’s end.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. (They start up the stairs. Ross is first.) Okay, here we go!
(Chandler has moved forward and is now underneath the couch as it heads up the first set of stairs.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, ready?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Turn.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Turn! Turn!
(As they turn the couch, Chandler gets sandwiched between the railing and the couch.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I don’t think we can turn anymore!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I don’t, I just don’t think it’s going to fit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah it will! Come on, up! Up-up-up! Up! Yes! Here we go! Pivot! (They start up the stairs again. Chandler is between the couch and the wall now.) Pivot! Piv-ot! Piv-et!! Piv-ett!!! Piv-et!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Shut up! Shut up! Shut up!!
(They set the couch down.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I don’t think it’s going to pivot anymore.

content.speaker: Chandler and Rachel
content.text: You think?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, let’s uh, let’s bring it back down and-and try again.
(As they start back down the couch drops a little bit and gets jammed. They try to free it to no avail.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, yeah, I think it’s really stuck now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t believe that didn’t work!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, me neither! I mean, you had a sketch!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, y’know, what did you mean when you said pivot?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is returning and finds Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! How’s it going? Did you make any new friends?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, yeah, I met this woman. (Starts for his room.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, whoa-whoa! What’s she like?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, well, she’s…really good in bed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, I thought you were gonna try to be friends first!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well look, hey, it’s all your fault!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! Why?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well because you didn’t give me advice! No! You gave me a pickup line! As soon as I told her I wanted to y’know, build a foundation and be friends first. I suddenly, through no fault of my own, became irresistible to her! (Pause) And her roommate!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What about the closeness?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Closeness-shmoshness! There was three of us for crying out loud!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is entering with a pizza and finds everyone but Ross there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Hey, who wants pizza?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, I do! I do! I do!
(They all walk over to get a slice.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, great! Can you believe I found it on the second floor?
(They all throw their pieces back as there is a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who is it?

content.speaker: Voice
content.text: N.Y.P.D!!

content.speaker: Phoebe and Joey
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, just a minute officer!!

(He throws his piece back in the box, runs into the living room, looks for a place to hide the pizza, finds one, slides the box under the couch, sits down on the table, and tries to quickly chew the food in his mouth.)

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: I’m looking for Phoebe Buffay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, God, it’s him! It’s that cop! God, I can’t believe it! He found me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, Phoebe, are you gonna go to jail?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, if I’m going down, I’m taking you (Points at all of them) with me. (They all look at her.) Harboring a fugitive? That’s one to three years minimum. Good luck Chandler. (She opens the door to the cop from before.) Okay, you can arrest me. Fine. But you’ll never make it stick and you know it!

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Yeah, but I kinda don’t have a choice, it’s my job. I mean, you understand right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yep! As long as you understand that I’m going to call my lawyer and once he puts you on the stand he’ll make you look like a fool. A fool!

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: I don’t like looking foolish. Y’know what? Maybe uh, I don’t arrest you today. Maybe I came by and you weren’t here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I would love it if I weren’t here!

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Okay, so since umm, you’re not going to jail tonight I was wondering if you would like to go to dinner with me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me?!

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Yeah. Ever since you flashed my badge at me, I kinda can’t stop thinking about you. You’re the prettiest, fake undercover whore I’ve ever seen.

content.speaker: Chandler and Joey
content.text: Nice!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! I didn’t see that coming! You’re-you’re asking me out!

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Yeah. I mean, I coulda done it better, but these people keep staring at me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, yeah, I’d like to go out with you officer…

content.speaker: Cop
content.text: Gary.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Gary.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Okay, so it’s a date.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! So—ooh, I gotta ask you though. How did you know where to find me?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Well you’re fingerprints were all over my badge so I just ran it through the computer and this was listed as your last known address so I just checked it out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, impressive.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Not as impressive as you. I gotta tell you, I looked at your record and you’ve done some pretty weird stuff.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, we’ll talk at dinner.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Okay. (He starts to leave.) So I’ll come by in a couple hours and pick you up?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, I can’t wait!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Okay. And don’t worry, I’m not just gonna take you out for donuts.
(Chandler busts out laughing and everyone just looks at him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He has a gun!

content.description: The couch store, Ross is talking to a saleswoman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’d like to return this couch. I’m not satisfied with it.
[The camera cuts to show the couch, which has been cut in half.]

content.speaker: The Saleswoman
content.text: You wanna return this couch? (Ross nods yes.) It’s cut in half!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s what I’m telling you.

content.speaker: The Saleswoman
content.text: Did you cut this couch in half?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This couch, is cut in half ! I would like to exchange it for one that is not cut in half!

content.speaker: The Saleswoman
content.text: You’re telling me this couch was delivered to you like this?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I am a reasonable man. I will accept store credit.

content.speaker: The Saleswoman
content.text: I’ll give you store credit in the amount of four dollars.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I take it.
